data: Contract for the sale of houses
A lead sheet damaged on top, right, and bottom sides, apparently preserved on left side.

The left side of the text appears to be completely preserved, as does the top of the text (even though the support is partially damaged at the top). Right margin of text not preserved, nor is the bottom of the text preserved.
Whether from Morgantina or Camarina remains uncertain; from the collection of Diego Ricotti Prina.
Comprehensive collection of archaeological material discovered in the province of Ragusa, with a particular focus on the sites of Kaukana, Kamarina, Castiglione and Monte Casasia
Case e terra a Kamarina e Morgantina nel III–II sec. a.C.
Giacomo Manganaro, «Case e terra a Kamarina e Morgantina nel III–II sec. a.C.», La Parola del Passato 44 (1989): 189–216
Inscriptions grecques dialectales de Sicile. Tome II.
Laurent Dubois, Inscriptions Grecques Dialectales de Sicile. Tome II. (Geneva: Droz, 2008)
More new readings of Hellenistic Sicilian real estate contracts involving women
Randall Souza, ‘More New Readings of Hellenistic Sicilian Real Estate Contracts Involving Women’, Zeitschrift Für Papyrologie Und Epigraphik 223 (2022): 71–81
Ἐπὶ Θέωνος Α οἰκίας ὠνεῖται πέντε Παντίμε Λυκίσκου Φίντων Λυκίσκου φυλακός Σωσίας Φιλωνίδας Ἡρακλείδας Ἄνταλλος
contract for the sale of houses
ISic030062. Contract for the sale of houses

1Ἐπὶ Θέωνος ..Α
2οἰκίας ὠν̣εῖται πέ[ντε]
3Παντίμε Λυκίσκου .
4Φίν̣των Λυκί[σ]κου φυλακ[ός]
5Σ[ω]σ̣ί̣ας Φιλωνίδας
6Ἡρα̣[κ]λείδας Ἄν̣τα[λλος]

1ΕΠΙΘΕΩΝΟΣ··Α
2ΟΙΚΙΑΣΩ.ΕΙΤΑΙΠΕ[...]
3ΠΑΝΤΙΜΕΛΥΚΙΣΚΟΥ·
4ΦΙ.ΤΩΝΛΥΚΙ[.]ΚΟΥΦΥΛΑΚ[..]
5Σ[.]..ΑΣΦΙΛΩΝΙΔΑΣ
6ΗΡ.[.]ΛΕΙΔΑΣΑ.ΤΑ[....]

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Previous editions are Manganaro's ed. pr. in PP 1989, and Dubois in IGDS II no. 56. This text and the apparatus are copied from Souza 2022 in ZPE;
  • 1: [...---], Manganaro. Neither M. nor Dubois read any letters on my Line 1, and M. inserts an additional unrestored line (dashes) between my Lines 1 and 2; [...........]ς οἰκίας, M. and D. but no sigma is visible on the sheet; πέ[...........?], M.
  • 3: [.......] Παντίας, M. and D.; Λυκίσκου ., M.
  • 4: Φ.λ.κ[..?], M. The upsilon after the phi is unusual: it is reversed compared to the other upsilons, i.e. the short part is on the right; also the more vertical hasta is extremely long and runs down into the next line.
  • 5: [---]Φιλωνίδας[---], M. and D.
  • 6: [---]ΑΣΙΔΑ.Λ .. ? .. Τ[---], M.

English translation

When Theon was in office...Pantime, daughter of Lykiskos...buys five houses...Phinton, son of Lykiskos, guardian...Sosias, Philonidas...Herakleidas, Antallos...

commentary

The engraving of this brief contract is extremely light and difficult to read. The list of names at the end, headed by the brother of the buyer (who is designated as the "guardian" of his sister, who could not transact business independently), likely comprises the guarantors of the contract.
